page.title: 01Glaciated Landscape/Baldoon
page.content: Flat deep and very fertile fields of clay all the rest of the surface is a congeries of little hills gentle in their outline verdant on their clothing and on some instances waring crowns of platation on their summit. Except for half mile inward from the carse it has in general a high and light soil and does not seem to have been naturally fertile but by the best of known means has been richly improved and now everywhere exhibits a well cultured and cheerful appearance with dry stone dykes and hawthornhedges well maintained. Bladnoch creamery producing cheese the Distillery whisky with Baldoon sawmill and farming being main working employment. Also people travel to Newton Stewart for work. Quiet area with large retired population.Leisure, shooting, River fishing Wigtown golf
